intro: Castalia advena, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, often blooming in the morning. Castalia advena is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many climbing plants. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields due to its adaptability and rapid growth.
